org.jpac

Interface CyclicTask


  • public interface CyclicTask
    used to implement cyclic tasks. Cyclic tasks are a new powerful feature of jPac. They can be used to implement functions that will be executed in every jPac cycle. This mechanism is used by jPac itself to track and save changes of configuration properties and to implement the cyclic interchange of process data using the vioss (versatile input/ouput subsystem). Feel free to use it for your needs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isFinished()
      used to check, if a cyclic has come to an end after it has been terminated by stop()
      void prepare()
      used to do some initializing.
      void run()
      is called by jPac on every cycle.
      void stop()
      is called by jPac during the shutdown.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        void run()
        is called by jPac on every cycle. Hint: This method must be implemented short, fast and robust because it effects the jPac cycle directly

      • prepare

        void prepare()
        used to do some initializing. Is called by jPac just before it starts processing.

      • stop

        void stop()
        is called by jPac during the shutdown. Can be used to clean up the context of the CyclicTask

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished()
        used to check, if a cyclic has come to an end after it has been terminated by stop()
        Returns:
